lexUnit.name: beg.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: ask (someone) earnestly or humbly for something.

sentence.text: They beg to be protected against partings , disease , death and sorrow -- ;
Their souls survive as a “ collective ghost ” which begs anyone entering the chamber to bury all the skeletons and bury them in a graveyard consecrated by a cleric of Mórr .
Of course her parents had begged her to return to New York .
They begged him to let them off this time , but he rang back hour after hour , day , after day : " Sell your car .
` Take these gold coins and go , beg your lady to join us at Inverkeithing .
He had begged her for a doctor .
Out on the teeming Paris street , she is accosted by a couple of zealous American tourists who beg her for autographs .
I wanted to cry , weep and beg the Almighty for mercy .
They begged forgiveness from the Mother Goddess and blessed the axe in a ritual of mourning before hacking down trees in autumn .
She begged me in tears to leave her alone -- to give her some peace . "
I accept the judgement of my fellow officers and , before I die , beg their forgiveness for having shamed them before the T'ang . "
` Mistress Hussey , " said the prince as she entered , ` we beg your forgiveness for keeping you waiting a little beyond the time we appointed .
She begged pardon at once for -- being so free as to presume I will be read but then , ma'am , you must blame yourself for encouraging in me that letter-writing soul .
` Do n't tell them anything about this , " begged Miss Watson , with sudden agitation .
` Oh , I beg your pardon , Rose .
Cease this folly , I beg you . "
Treat him kindly , I beg you . "
` You 're sure you do n't want them to come ? " asked David , who had been begged by the children to make her change her mind .
By nine that same evening I was being begged to go and get them !
Caxton House and Guinness Mahon 's City offices saw frantic activity as existing investors were begged over the phone to increase their contributions in a desperate bid to bridge the gap .
One Sunday he begged the congregation of a Paris church not to assassinate him .
If he nagged , she would beg him not to rummage in her past .
` Harry Paget asked for me , I begged Prinny 's permission , and he finally relented . "
I begged a tankard of ale from a surly cook and went to warm myself before the hall fire until my master roused me .
Take it off I beg you Elissia , remove it from me .
He knocked on the door and begged for aid .
Yelling and whistling , the audience begged for more .
I bet you beg for it on bended knees !
At his trial Dennis broke down completely , begging for mercy , but the evidence was irrefutable , and he was sentenced to death .
` I did n't go begging to the DSS , " said Mr Deaves , 39 .
All I ate that day was a piece of bread , which I begged from a farmer eating his supper .
She would not beg from him , could never try to claim whatever might -- or might not -- be hers by rights .
` Reconsider , I beg of you .
` You can not do this , I beg of you ! "
` Then , ma'am , I beg of you , let Ferdinando go to England and bring home our son . "
` Wait , Theodosia ! " he begged anxiously .
` Do n't leave me ! " she begged hoarsely .
` Do n't be angry ! " she begged quickly .
He begged that a citizen army should be formed , declaring , ` an untrained man with a rifle would be useless in modern warfare " .
Shildon had been polite and apologetic and twice begged that his investigation be kept secret .
